column4: hi what eles do i got for dvd player i need somthing with close caption in it
hard of hearing in one ear
vlc verson for ubuntu dont have close caption in it
will use it for other stuff
what i got
if you have the .sub file, vlc works
so, you tried the subtitles option in vlc and it didnt work?
sorry, couldnt get you.. 8.6b?
totem works good, or smplayer
you mean subtitles, right?
hmmn, yes, subtitles.. I am not suire why it isnt working for you.. so you I presume you have a dvd and playing it in vlc, right? then check preferences-->video-->subtitles
then I guess the dvd doesnt have that .sub file.. unless the dvd comes with the relavant .SUB file, it wont work.. you can dig the internet to dload a sub file for that media
then you could give "totem" a try, or "smplayer" is also good.. see if they show you the subtitles
totem is already installed
what is the error? it plays the video or not?
I guess vlc didnt exit properly, go to system monitor and kill vlc and esd
go to system monitor.. the thing that shows your comp performance
main menu-->system-->admin-->system monitor
not there? wierd.. ok type this in terminal: "pkill vlc" and "pkill esd" (without the quotes) and try playing with totem
so, what happened?
ok, so you dont have multimedia codecs..
